    • Method Detail

      • breadthFirstSearch

        public static void breadthFirstSearch(int start,
                                      int destination,
                                      Room[] maze,
                                      int widthOfMaze)
        Uses breadth-first search to find the shortest path between starting room and the destination room. BFS wikipedia
        Parameters:
        start - index of the room where the search is started
        destination - index of the room that the algorithm is looking for
        maze - array of rooms
        widthOfMaze - Labyrinth has mazeWidth x mazeWidth rooms, thus mazeWidth is the amount of rooms that this maze has on a row or column

      • aStar

        public static void aStar(int start,
                         int destination,
                         Room[] maze,
                         int widthOfMaze)

        Uses A* algorithm to find the shortest path between starting room and the destination room. ALgorithm uses as heuristic the sum of the current distance and the sum of differences between measured x and y from destinations x and y; for example, being measured: distance = 3, (x=1, y=3), destination: (x=5, y=1) -> heuristic 3 + (|5-1| + |1-3|) = 9. The heuristic never overestimates the distance and as such the algorithm always finds the shortest path. A* wikipedia

        Parameters:
        start - index of the room where the search is started
        destination - index of the room that the algorithm is looking for
        maze - array of rooms
        widthOfMaze - Labyrinth has mazeWidth x mazeWidth rooms, thus mazeWidth is the amount of rooms that this maze has on a row or column
